page.title: 13HOUSING
page.content: Most houses in Crich are built of Derbyshire stone,roofed with stone tiles,slates or clay tiles.Some of the newer houses are built with brick or reconstituted stone. Here are 2 different types of house owned by the families of 2 fourth year Crich pupils. {BOY ONE}_My house is 7 years 9 months old.It is built out of reconstituted stone with a concrete - tiled roof.We are on our second extension already. {BOY TWO} _ My house is about 300 years old and is built of sandstone.The roof is of slate but the barn roof is tiles and stone slabs.Outside there is a well about 25 feet deep and at the bottom there is supposed to be a pot of gold sovereigns.
